content.question: If an inductor of <math alttext="40.0 millihenrys" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>40.0</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>mH</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> is in a circuit with a constant current of <math alttext="1.2 milliamperes" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1.2</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>mA</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, how much energy is stored in the inductor?

choices.label: <math alttext="5.76 times 10 to the negative 8 power joule" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>5.76</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>8</mn></mrow></msup><mtext> J</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="2.4 times 10 to the negative 5 power joule" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2.4</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>5</mn></mrow></msup><mtext> J</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="2.88 times 10 to the negative 8 power joule" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2.88</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>8</mn></mrow></msup><mtext> J</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="28.8 joules" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mn>28.8</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>J</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>
The energy is zero because the current is not changing.

content.answer: <math alttext="2.88 times 10 to the negative 8 power joule" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2.88</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>8</mn></mrow></msup><mtext> J</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>

skill.text: 2.B: Calculate or estimate an unknown quantity with units from known quantities, by selecting and following a logical computational pathway.
